about.bio: I like to question ideas & challenge the norm. I have always taken an interest in programming & designâ€” I enjoy the systematic approach to problem-solving coupled with the abstract creativity.  When I'm not coding, you can find me camping, hiking, mountain biking, practicing yoga, writing, reading, tending to my plants, or traveling.

timeline.title: Background
timeline.text: I was awarded 2 research grants for my undergrad lab work with conducting polymers. I completed a Pharmaceutical R&D Internship at the company that makes Tylenol. I graduated from Penn State University in 2015 with a B.S. in Biomedical Engineering.
timeline.subtitle: Welp, plans have changed.

timeline.title: Professional Experience
timeline.text: I started out as a Quality Assurance Specialist at a top software company in the electronic health record industry. I then transitioned to be a project manager for the software implementations, leading small teams to success. I am currently a consultant that assists with post-live optimization & support of the system.
timeline.subtitle: TLDR; I know how to get $#!+ done.

timeline.title: Web Development
timeline.text: After taking several computer science classes in college, and teaching myself pieces of various languages throughout the years, I decided to get serious about becoming a web developer. In 2020, I graduated a Full Stack Web Development Boot Camp. I am continuing to work on personal projects, solidify concepts, & learn new technologies.
timeline.subtitle: I'm on a mission to master the front-end.

timeline.title: Web Design
timeline.text: In 2020, I joined The Underdog Foundation as the Vice President & Technical Lead. Through this cause, I have had the pleasure to donate my time to designing websites for small, local businesses impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. I continue to look for opportunities where I can bring my knowledge of development, content writing, UI/UX design, responsive design, SEO, and more.
timeline.subtitle: Learned HTML/CSS on MySpace, now I'm here

categories.subtitle: I'm on a mission to master the front-end.

projects.title: HelpersConnect
projects.description: A MERN-stack app that allows charitable organizations to manage events and volunteers.

projects.title: Code Connect
projects.description: A full-stack social platform for developers to connect to meet, collaborate, and learn

projects.title: Date Nite
projects.description: A one-click solution to planning dates utilizing server-side APIs.

projects.title: Read-Da-Book
projects.description: An application to manage a reading list of books on a SQL database rendered with Handlebars.

projects.title: Weather Dashboard
projects.description: A weather application utilizing server-side APIs and persistent data via local storage.

projects.title: Code Quiz
projects.description: A vanilla Javascript quiz about vanilla Javascript.

projects.title: The Underdog Foundation
projects.description: Website for The Underdog Foundation, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.

contact.text: If you have any feedback, ideas, or opportunities for me, or if you just wanna say wazzup, email me or message me on LinkedIn.
